title: How to Run a Restaurant Business
headline: This free online course elaborates on all the aspects and elements required to start and run a successful restaurant.
description: Are you a restaurant enthusiast, a hospitality professional or a chef who dreams of having a restaurant but lacks the knowledge to get started? Or are you a restaurant owner encountering difficulties in finding their feet? This course explores all the necessary steps, inside secrets, elements and correct procedures to set up and run a successful and popular restaurant with customers clamouring to return.

courseDescription:
Restaurants are a very demanding business and opening and running them is no small feat. As a multi-faceted operation, running restaurants is also risky as around 50% of them shut their doors in the first year. This course, 'How to Run a Restaurant Business’, is a professional course that takes the guesswork out of setting up and running a successful restaurant. It introduces you to the ins and outs of this business. The techniques, concepts and methods will help inspire you to start your restaurant and make your dream business a reality. 

Using video-based lessons, we walk you through all the processes, procedures and tasks needed to launch a successful restaurant business, avoid mistakes and save you from the ordeal of failing. We guide you through the essential building blocks for planning, launching and running a successful restaurant business. Investigate how to prepare a business plan and choose the type of restaurants you desire. Discover how to plan a menu, the importance of customer relations and all the backend functions and tasks related to administration, financing, marketing, staffing and inventory management. Become familiar with all the elements and tools to make your restaurant successful and popular. This course also helps existing restaurant owners identify gaps in their functioning and improve their chances of success. By the end, you will be well prepared and confident enough to start a restaurant of your own or improve upon your existing one. 

Being a restaurateur nowadays is a lucrative career and business option. But running a restaurant successfully and having a loyal customer or patron base is one of the most challenging aspects of this business and the biggest reason for failure. So if you are looking to run a restaurant, this course is the key to making your dream a reality. It is also designed for those already in the business to improve their chances of success significantly. It will teach you everything you need to know to run a successful restaurant business. So enrol today and become a sensation.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our certificate pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, get introduced to the business of Restaurants. Start with an overview of the industry, key terms, and elements, and then get familiar with all the best procedures and concepts to plan and start your restaurant. You then learn the best ways to plan a perfect menu manage the drinks segment and handle purchases, inventory, and storage.
topics: Planning a Restaurant Business – Learning Outcomes
Planning a Restaurant Business - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Financing Your Business, Recruitment and Other Tasks
modules.description: This module covers key elements related to customer support, administration, marketing, and finance you will need for the smooth functioning of your restaurant and getting a business out of it. The topics covered are managing finance, recruitment, safety and cleanliness, use of technology, customer relations, daily operations, and marketing policy.
topics: Financing Your Business,Recruitment and Other Tasks- Learning Outcomes
Financing Your Business and finding Employees
Maintaining Hygiene and Use of Technology
Teamwork, Customer Relations and Marketing Policy
Financing Your Business, Recruitment and Other Tasks- Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
topics: How to Run a Restaurant Business Assessment

slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module, you will be able to:
    • Explain restaurant, restaurant management, and the restaurant industry in detail.
    • Outline all the initial steps and elements needed to plan and set up a great restaurant business.
    • Describe how to create an excellent layout for your restaurant areas.
    • Recognise the legal specifications to open and run a restaurant smoothly and safely.
    • Discuss the importance of menu and drinks in the restaurant business.
    • Describe menu planning and drinks management in detail.
    • Recall how to source goods and manage inventory in your restaurant.
    • Explain proper ways to store products and foodstuff.

  • An Overview of the Restaurant Industry

  • Lesson Summary

    • Restaurant management entails the establishment’s planning, scheduling, and day-to-day management.
    • Fine dining establishments offer an upscale dining experience that frequently consists of multiple courses (e.g. salad, appetizer, entree, dessert).
    • A restaurant focuses exclusively on food and beverages services, unlike a hotel that also offers lodging with food and beverages.
    • Making a successful business plan requires extensive research, numerous questions, financial projections for the present and future, and genuine soul searching.
    • Your business plan will help you clarify your vision and potential, as well as identify potential roadblocks.
    • Repeat business is guaranteed if you have the right atmosphere and food, a good selection of wines by the glass and bottle, and a decent selection of local beers on tap.
    • Your restaurant’s first impression is critical, and you must keep relevant factors of your restaurant’s first impression in mind.
    • Arrange all plants, trees, and decorations so that they conceal undesirable views, protect customers from the wind, and absorb noise, especially if you offer outdoor seating.
    • You need to establish a relationship with your local authority to plan permission, build regulations, and any structural changes you wish to make to the property.

  • Lesson Summary

    • Restaurant management entails the establishment’s planning, scheduling, and day-to-day management.
    • Fine dining establishments offer an upscale dining experience that frequently consists of multiple courses (e.g. salad, appetizer, entree, dessert).
    • A restaurant focuses exclusively on food and beverages services, unlike a hotel that also offers lodging with food and beverages.
    • Making a successful business plan requires extensive research, numerous questions, financial projections for the present and future, and genuine soul searching.
    • Your business plan will help you clarify your vision and potential, as well as identify potential roadblocks.
    • Repeat business is guaranteed if you have the right atmosphere and food, a good selection of wines by the glass and bottle, and a decent selection of local beers on tap.
    • Your restaurant’s first impression is critical, and you must keep relevant factors of your restaurant’s first impression in mind.
    • Arrange all plants, trees, and decorations so that they conceal undesirable views, protect customers from the wind, and absorb noise, especially if you offer outdoor seating.
    • You need to establish a relationship with your local authority to plan permission, build regulations, and any structural changes you wish to make to the property.

  • Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module, you will be able to:
    • Describe how to raise money for your Restaurant business.
    • Estimate, evaluate, and control expenses in your restaurant.
    • Indicate the process to hire and train the right person for the job.
    • Recognise the must-haves safety protocols and hygiene measures for the smooth running of the restaurant.
    • Discuss the importance of technology and list some ideas and applications.
    • Summarise day to day activities of a restaurant.
    • Describe how to manage your customer.
    • Outline the various ways to promote and market your restaurant.

  • Financing Your Business

  • Lesson Summary

    • Capital Expenditures are funds spent by a restaurant on acquiring, upgrading, and maintaining physical assets such as land, plants, buildings, technology, and equipment.
    • Your daily business review is a report that you create each day by tracking your sales, labor costs, and customer costs.
    • To find suitable employees, you can take referrals from employees of your restaurant or search in local colleges.
    • The more information you provide your employees through training about how your business operates your expectations, your concept, and your menu, the better employees will be.
    • You and your staff must understand the causes and prevention of food poisoning.
    • Waiters should check milk, cream, and butter on a shift-by-shift basis to ensure they have valid use-by dates and do not smell rancid.
    • Maintaining a clean restaurant is the first step toward food safety; it significantly reduces the threats of pests and vermin.
    • In every branch of the catering service industry, employees' and customer's first aids and exits in an emergency are critical.
    • By understanding the data collected by a POS system, the operator gains greater control over inventory, bar, revenue, labor scheduling, overtime, customer traffic, and service.
